question: where does the last name orozco originate from
api_result:
The last name Orozco has Spanish origins. It is believed to derive from a place name in Spain, specifically from the region of Castile. The name may be linked to the Basque word "oroz," which means "place of the oak," suggesting a geographical connection to oak trees or oak groves. 

Orozco is a relatively common surname in Spanish-speaking countries and among people of Hispanic descent. It has historical significance and can be traced back to various notable figures and families in Spanish history. The surname has also spread to other regions, particularly in Latin America, due to colonization and migration.
